section.title: File Definition
section.p: A file is considered to be a DocBook 5 document when the namespace is http://docbook.org/ns/docbook.

section.title: Default Document Templates
section.p: There are a variety of default DocBook 5 templates available when creating new documents from templatesnew documents from templates and they can be found in: Framework Templates DocBook 5 DocBook 5.0 and Framework Templates DocBook 5 DocBook 5.1 .
New document templates for both DocBook 5 documents are located in the /frameworks/docbook/templates/Docbook5.0 folder.
New document templates for both DocBook 5.1 documents are located in the /frameworks/docbook/templates/Docbook5.1 folder.

section.title: Default Schema for Validation and Content Completion
section.p: The default schema that is used if one is not detected is docbookxi.rng and it is stored in /frameworks/docbook/5.0/rng/ (or for DocBook 5.1 in /frameworks/docbook/5.1/rng/). Other types of schemas for various DocBook versions are also located in various folders inside the /frameworks/docbook/ directory.

section.title: Default CSS
section.p: The default CSS files used for rendering DocBook content in Author mode is stored in /frameworks/docbook/css/.
By default, these default CSS files are merged with any that are specified in the document. For more information, see .

section.title: Transformation Scenarios
section.p: includes numerous built-in DocBook transformation scenarios that allow you to transform DocBook 5 documents to a variety of outputs, such as WebHelp, PDF, HTML, HTML Chunk, XHTML, XHTML Chunk, and EPUB. also includes a DocBook 5.1 transformation scenario for Assembly documents. All of them are listed in the DocBook 5 section in the Configure Transformation Scenario(s) dialog box.
